AmazonS3::get_object ( $  bucket,
$  filename,
$  opt = null 
)

Get Object

Reads the contents of an object within a bucket.

public

Parameters:
string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
  • string lastmodified - (Optional) The LastModified header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'etag' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.
  • string etag - (Optional) The ETag header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'lastmodified' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.
  • boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
  • string $range - (Optional) A range of bytes to fetch from the file. Useful for downloading partial bits or completing incomplete files. Range notated with a hyphen (e.g. 0-10485759). Defaults to the complete file.
Returns:
TarzanHTTPResponse

Example Usage:

<?php
require_once('tarzan.class.php');

/**
 * Instantiate a new AmazonS3 object using the settings from the config.inc.php file.
 */
$s3 = new AmazonS3();


/**
 * Retrieve a file from S3.
 */
$file = $s3->get_object('warpshare.test.eu', 'sample.txt');


/**
 * Display the file, setting the correct content-type.
 */
header('Content-type:' . $file->headers['content-type']);
echo $file->body;


?>
See also:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectGET.html
